attributes.action: publish the long-delayed review into the widespread misuse of antipsychotic – or ‘chemical cosh’ – drugs.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government initiated a review into the prescribing of antipsychotic drugs to dementia patients over a year ago following claims of misuse but has yet to publish a report.

Earlier this year, an Alzheimer’s Research Trust-funded study published in Lancet Neurology found that antipsychotic drugs double the risk of death for many patients if used over a three year period. As many as 100,000 people with dementia are routinely prescribed antipsychotics in UK care homes.

The following organizations are calling for the publication of the government’s report:

Alzheimer’s Society; Alzheimer’s Research Trust; All Party Parliamentary Group on Dementia; Barchester Healthcare; Age Concern and Help the Aged; English Community Care Association; Carers UK; Local Government Association Community Wellbeing Board; Counsel and Care; UNISON; National Care Forum.
